content.description:
P1 - had some easy nailing but was followed at 5.10+

P2 - STUNNING roof that needs to be free’d! Looks tough: #5’s & 6’s

P3 - C1 w/ reasonable free potential

P4 - mostly exposed scramble with one or two thoughtful moves
content.protection:
3x tiny - #3.

2x #4-6.

3x #3 beaks.

Offset nuts and cams useful

.

2x 60m ropes for descent.
content.location: Short drive around to East face of NNL Domes (see topo). Look for the big roof just past burnt out camper.

content.description:
P1 - beautiful beak seam with a few fixed heads & bolts

P2 - PRIMO. one of the best pitches in the MM. Big, steep roof. Intermittent hands and OW, ends with a few lie-back moves to the P1 anchors of ‘Ratshit Crazy’
content.location: Obvious right trending roof on Eastface of NNL Domes. (See too) Start approach just past burnt-out camper.

content.description: A weird and fun climb not like anything else you've done. The crumbly granite on the sides is split right down the middle of the groove by dense, solid chunks of a white dike. The rock of the dike is much more durable and will crumble onto your belayer less than if you use the sides, though some moves require it. Still, wear a helmet for the belay!
content.location: A separate formation from the typical Never Never Land routes, this climb is just up and to your right as you arrive at the campsite/parking area along the 4x4 road. Look for the water groove with a large dike running down the middle - this is the climb!
